results.title: BBC News - Police in Germany 'foil asylum seeker suicide attack'
results.summary: German police arrest a teenage asylum seeker suspected of planning a suicide attack in Berlin.
results.body: <body xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/ddb75078-b47b-7945-8619-e31a5beb5284"><image id="96273103"/><paragraph role="introduction">German police have arrested a teenage asylum seeker suspected of planning a suicide attack in Berlin, Brandenburg state officials say.</paragraph><paragraph>The suspect, 17, was arrested in the Uckermark district, Interior Minister Karl-Heinz SchrÃ¶ter announced.</paragraph><paragraph>But Brandenburg police say they have not confirmed reports that the teen, who entered Germany in 2015, is Syrian and was definitely planning an attack.</paragraph><paragraph>In December, a jihadist killed 12 people with a lorry in Berlin.</paragraph><paragraph>That attack on a Christmas market by Anis Amri, a Tunisian, put security services under intense scrutiny because of the way in which the attacker, who was later shot dead by police in Italy, evaded their surveillance and crossed European borders undetected.</paragraph><crosshead>'Farewell message'</crosshead><paragraph>Special forces arrested the teenager after police received a tip-off, Brandenburg police <!-- CPS Asset ID: 40097785 --><link><caption>tweeted</caption><url platform="highweb" href="https://twitter.com/PolizeiBB/status/869534845168439296/photo/1"/></link> (in German). He had sent a message to his family saying farewell and that he was joining the "jihad", the police said.</paragraph><paragraph>The message was sent via WhatsApp in the past week and Brandenburg authorities received the tip-off late on Monday from two other German states, a police spokesman told the Associated Press (AP).</paragraph><paragraph>The Brandenburg interior ministry said the suspect was Syrian but police tweeted that neither the "Syrian nationality" nor "concrete attack plans" could yet be confirmed, and that investigations continued.</paragraph><paragraph>Investigators are looking into whether the suspect may have falsely registered as a Syrian, police spokesman Torsten Herbst told the AP.</paragraph>  <list type="unordered">    <listItem><!-- CPS Asset ID: 39096833 --><itemMeta overtyped-headline="Ten attacks a day on Germany migrants"><url href="/news/world-europe-39096833" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/2fbde0d3-669b-d94a-91f0-f39adc83eeb4"/><assetTypeCode xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/2fbde0d3-669b-d94a-91f0-f39adc83eeb4">STY</assetTypeCode><assetId Nearly 10 attacks a day on migrants in 2016</headline><shortHeadline xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/5ea20ef4-d93d-1741-8906-088c14ea049b">Ten attacks a day on Germany migrants</shortHeadline><summary xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/5ea20ef4-d93d-1741-8906-088c14ea049b">More than 3,500 attacks were carried out on migrants and asylum shelters in Germany last year.</summary><section id="99123" name="Europe" uri="/news/world/europe" url-identifier="/news/world/europe" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/2fbde0d3-669b-d94a-91f0-f39adc83eeb4"/><title xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/2fbde0d3-669b-d94a-91f0-f39adc83eeb4">BBC News - Germany hate crime: Nearly 10 attacks a day on migrants in 2016</title><firstCreated drop in German asylum seekers"><url href="/news/world-europe-38584705" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007"/><assetTypeCode xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">38584705</assetId><headline xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/6109db93-2ed0-a944-88e5-592030ec4319">Migrant crisis: Germany sees massive drop in asylum seekers</headline><shortHeadline xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/6109db93-2ed0-a944-88e5-592030ec4319">Massive drop in German asylum seekers</shortHeadline><summary xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/6109db93-2ed0-a944-88e5-592030ec4319">Germany says 280,000 new arrivals sought asylum in 2016, a drop of over 600,000 on the previous year.</summary><section id="99123" name="Europe" uri="/news/world/europe" url-identifier="/news/world/europe" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007"/><title xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">BBC News - Migrant crisis: Germany sees massive drop in asylum seekers</title><firstCreated xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">2017-01-11T11:14:50+00:00</firstCreated><firstPublished xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">2017-01-11T11:14:51+00:00</firstPublished><lastUpdated xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">2017-01-11T13:40:46+00:00</lastUpdated><lastPublished xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">2017-01-11T14:39:26+00:00</lastPublished><changeQueueId xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">295621125</changeQueueId><changeQueueTimestamp xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">2017-01-11T14:39:25+00:00</changeQueueTimestamp><publicationStatus xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">PUBLISHED</publicationStatus><language xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">en-gb</language><site id="825" code="news-v6" name="BBC News" front-page-uri="/news/front_page" url-identifier="/news" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007"/><provider xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">cps</provider><workerCallingCard xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">app144.back.live.telhc.local-55</workerCallingCard><hasShortForm xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset/9f56f2d5-654c-cb40-a38b-dd122ae1c007">true</hasShortForm></itemMeta></listItem>    <listItem><!-- CPS Asset ID: 40097787 --><link><caption>Can the EU stop another Amri?</caption><url platform="highweb" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-38517768"/></link></listItem>  </list><paragraph>The suspect had been living in a home for unaccompanied underage refugees in Uckermark, north-east of Berlin, since 2016 and had never before come to the attention of police. </paragraph><paragraph>He is currently being questioned and the home is being searched by the state criminal investigation office, Brandenburg police said.</paragraph><paragraph>Details of the alleged plot cannot be released due to police operations, which are ongoing, the police added.</paragraph><paragraph>Some 280,000 asylum seekers arrived in Germany last year, a drop of more than 600,000 compared to 2015.</paragraph><paragraph>Chancellor Angela Merkel's decision to temporarily open the country's borders at the height of the European migrant crisis divided opinion and immigration is an important political issue ahead of the parliamentary election later this year.</paragraph><paragraph>Mrs Merkel <!-- CPS Asset ID: 40097786 --><link><caption>recently moved to try and ramp up deportations</caption><url platform="highweb" href="http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-38919038"/></link> of failed asylum seekers.</paragraph><paragraph>Tunisia had refused to take back Anis Amri after his asylum bid was rejected and pressure has increased on Mrs Merkel's government since the December attack.</paragraph><paragraph>In April, a 16-year-old Syrian refugee was convicted in western Germany for planning a bomb attack and sentenced to two years in a youth prison. The judges in Cologne said the plot was at a very early stage and did not yet pose any threat to the public.</paragraph></body>
results.shortFormBody: <shortFormBody xmlns="http://www.bbc.co.uk/asset" xml:space="preserve" xml:base="http://www.bbc.co.uk/article/ddb75078-b47b-7945-8619-e31a5beb5284"><paragraph>German police have arrested a teenage asylum seeker suspected of planning a suicide attack in Berlin, Brandenburg state officials say.</paragraph><paragraph>The suspect, 17, was arrested in the Uckermark district, Interior Minister Karl-Heinz SchrÃ¶ter announced.</paragraph><paragraph>But Brandenburg police say they have not confirmed reports that the teen, who entered Germany in 2015, is Syrian and was definitely planning an attack.</paragraph><paragraph>In December, a jihadist killed 12 people with a lorry in Berlin.</paragraph></shortFormBody>

96273103.caption: A Christmas market in Berlin was attacked in December, leaving 12 people dead
96273103.altText: A policeman places a candle on behalf of a mourner at a makeshift memorial the day after a truck drove into a crowded Christmas market in the city center on December 20, 2016 in Berlin, Germany.

96273105.altText: View of the Berlin skyline seen from Potsdamer Platz to Alexanderplatz

items.headline: Berlin truck attack: Can the EU stop another Amri?

93269131.caption: Amri was eventually shot dead in a suburb of Milan

93268018.caption: Anis Amri drove a lorry laden with steel beams into a crowded Christmas market in Berlin
93268018.altText: The damaged lorry after the Christmas market attack (20 Dec)

93282985.caption: A security check on the France-Germany border on 22 December during the hunt for Anis Amri
93282985.altText: Franco-German security check, 22 Dec 16, in Ottmarsheim, eastern France

93282988.caption: Amri's pistol: He used it to kill the Polish lorry driver and to fire at Italian police

93282990.caption: The .22-calibre pistol that Amri used to kill the Polish lorry driver and to fire at Italian police
93282990.altText: Amri's pistol, displayed by Italian police, 4 Jan 17

93282992.caption: On 21 December German police issued this wanted poster for Anis Amri
93282992.altText: German police wanted poster for Anis Amri, 21 Dec 16

93290444.caption: Travellers are now checked at the Austria-Germany border - and both are in Schengen
93290444.altText: Border police check cars at Schwarzbach, on Salzburg-Munich motorway, 15 Dec 16

93290445.caption: Monitoring the Romania-Moldova border: Data exchanges are key to fighting terrorism and organised crime
93290445.altText: Romanian police monitoring border with Moldova, 2011

93283600.altText: Franco-German security check, 22 Dec 16, in Strasbourg, eastern France

items.shortHeadline: Berlin truck attack: Can the EU stop another Amri?
items.summary: What more can the EU do to stop attacks like the Berlin atrocity, the BBC's Laurence Peter asks.
items.title: BBC News - Berlin truck attack: Can the EU stop another Amri?

items.headline: Berlin truck attacker Anis Amri killed in Milan

93089921.caption: German federal police released images of Anis Amri
93089921.altText: German federal police handout pictures of Berlin market attack suspect Anis Amri (21 December)

93112051.caption: IS released a video showing Amri pledging allegiance
93112051.altText: image grab taken from a propaganda video showing Anis Amri

93105303.caption: The shootout took place in the Sesto San Giovanni area of Milan
93105303.altText: Police and forensics at the scene of a shootout in Milan

93105305.caption: The shootout took place in the Sesto San Giovanni area of Milan
93105305.altText: Italian police cordon off an area after a shootout between police and a man in Milan"s Sesto San Giovanni neighbourhood, early Friday, Dec. 23, 2016.

93105307.caption: Mourning continues at Breitscheidplatz in central Berlin, where the attack took place
93105307.altText: Candles and flowers are placed at Breitscheidplatz in remembrance of the victims of the 19 December terrorist attack in Berlin, Germany, 23 December 2016.

93105310.altText: A weapon is marked as evidence as it lays on the ground on 23 December 2016 after Anis Amri shootout

93046280.caption: The lorry's Polish driver, Lukasz Urban, was found dead in the passenger seat

93107168.caption: Police officer Cristian Movio was injured in the shoulder in the shootout
93107168.altText: Injured police officer Cristian Movio talks on the phone in hospital, bandages on his shoulder

93112049.altText: image grab taken from a propaganda video showing Anis Amri

items.shortHeadline: Berlin attacker shot dead in Milan
items.summary: Italian police shoot dead Berlin attacker Anis Amri near a Milan train station after he opened fire.
items.title: BBC News - Berlin truck attacker Anis Amri killed in Milan

items.headline: Erdogan threatens to scrap EU-Turkey migrant deal

95140897.caption: Mr Erdogan has directed a series of controversial slurs at the Dutch
95140897.altText: People walk past a large banner showing a portrait of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Taksim Square, Istanbul, 13 March

95142705.caption: Police dogs were used to control protesters in Rotterdam
95142705.altText: A police dog bites a demonstrator after riots break out at the Turkish consulate in Rotterdam, Netherlands, 12 March

95142713.caption: Turks have been protesting outside the Dutch consulate in Istanbul
95142713.altText: A group of Turks protest outside the Dutch consulate in Istanbul, 12 March

95142809.caption: Mark Rutte (right) faces a strong challenge from Geert Wilders (left)
95142809.altText: Mark Rutte (right) and Geert Wilders leave after a national televised debate at Erasmus University in Rotterdam, Netherlands, 12 March

95185215.caption: The EU-Turkey deal has seen migrants returned from Greece to Turkey, easing the flow of people to Europe
95185215.altText: This file photo taken on April 8, 2016 shows a police officer escorting a migrant from a Turkish ferry carrying the second group of migrants deported from Europe to Turkey as they arrive at the port of Dikili district in Izmir. Turkey on March 15, 2017

95185219.altText: A handout photo made available by the Turkish President Press office shows Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan waves to supporters during the opening ceremony for various facilities in Sakarya city, Turkey, 16 March 2017

items.shortHeadline: Turkey threatens to scrap migrant deal
items.summary: President Erdogan says the EU can "forget about" Turkey re-admitting migrants, as a row continues.
items.title: BBC News - Erdogan threatens to scrap EU-Turkey migrant deal

items.headline: Germany attacks: What is going on?

90504807.caption: Nine mostly young people were killed in Munich

90509433.caption: The attacker in Reutlingen was arrested after killing a woman

90509437.caption: "Not in my name" - refugees in Wuerzburg protest against the attack by a 17-year-old asylum seeker
90509437.altText: Refugees in Wuerzburg have demonstrated after the attack there, carried out by a 17-year-old asylum seeker

90509484.caption: The incidents included a suicide bombing in Ansbach

90509486.caption: IS has said it wants to target Germany and claimed the Wuerzburg attacker acted for the group

93042258.caption: Christmas tree remains caught in the front of the lorry that struck a busy Christmas market in Berlin
93042258.altText: The front of the lorry that struck a busy Christmas market in Berlin

90504805.caption: The attacks included a suicide bombing
90504805.altText: The entrance of a music festival where a suicide bomber blew himself up

items.shortHeadline: Germany attacks: What is going on?
